law.text: The property of all corporations, except where otherwise provided by law, shall be assessed in the name of the corporation in the same manner as that of a natural person, except that, when legally called on, the chief officer shall report a full statement of the property of the corporation for taxation, and, for a failure, shall be subject to the penalties provided by law for a similar failure by a natural person in listing his property.
law.history: Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 338, sec. 16, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 496, sec. 2, effective August 1, 1986. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 4085, 4091.
